intro: Capsella bursa-pastoris ellipsoidea, commonly known as the common shepherd's purse, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive triangular or heart-shaped seed pods. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. Its small white or purple flowers appear in clusters and bloom from late spring to early summer. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
